snippet: As prosecutors arrested dozens of top Muslim Brotherhood members, a senior Egyptian jurist was sworn in as acting head of state.
abstract: Remnants of Egypt's old government reassert themselves within hours of military ouster of Pres Mohamed Morsi; crackdown leaves scores of his Muslim Brotherhood backers under arrest, their television stations closed and former officials restored to powerful posts; little-known judge Adli Mansour is sworn in as acting head of state.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD, DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MAYY EL SHEIKH
byline.contributor: Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: As prosecutors arrested dozens of top Muslim Brotherhood members, a senior Egyptian jurist was sworn in as acting head of state.

headline.sub:
Brotherhood Rejects
Role in Transition as
Jurist Is Sworn In
headline.main: Crackdown on Morsi Backers Deepens Divide in Egypt
headline.print_headline: Morsi Supporters Face Crackdown, Deepening  Divide

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
